meanings.definition: The process of creating a chromolithograph.
meanings.sent1: Chromolithographing involves using multiple colors to make a colorful print.
meanings.sent2: I learned about chromolithographing in my art history class.
meanings.sent3: Why did the artist bring a rainbow to the chromolithographing party? To add more colors!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a canvas, chromolithographing memories in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of chromolithographing lies in the intricate layering of colors.

meanings.definition: The act of producing a chromolithograph.
meanings.sent1: After hours of work, the chromolithographing was finally complete.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of historic chromolithographings.
meanings.sent3: The printer told a joke while chromolithographing, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to chromolithographing was as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skill in chromolithographing was unmatched in the art world.

meanings.sent1: She enjoys chromolithographing as a hobby in her free time.
meanings.sent2: The artist spent hours chromolithographing the intricate design.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried chromolithographing with its paw, leaving colorful paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Chromolithographing the memories of childhood brought a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The painter's hands moved swiftly, chromolithographing a masterpiece before our eyes.
